abstract.p: CNNfn, CNN's financial news network, will expand its programming time to 24 hours from 18 on weekdays, filling much of the additional time with extensive coverage of overseas markets (S)

block.p: CNNfn, CNN's financial news network, will expand its programming time to 24 hours from 18 on weekdays starting June 20, network executives said yesterday.
Executives said they were planning to fill much of that additional programming time with extensive coverage of overseas markets.
CNNfn, CNN's financial news network, will expand its programming time to 24 hours from 18 on weekdays starting June 20, network executives said yesterday.
Executives said they were planning to fill much of that additional programming time with extensive coverage of overseas markets.
The expansion in hours is part of an overhaul being undertaken at the network by its recently appointed president, C. Shelby Coffey III.
Another part of the network's overhaul begins this morning, with the first installment of CNNfn's new weekday morning show, ''Market Call.''

With Rhonda Schaffler, senior CNN correspondent, as anchor, it will cover the first hour and a half of trading after the 9:30 a.m. opening on the New York Stock Exchange. Contributing to the show will be Allan Chernoff, the former CNBC correspondent, who officially joined CNNfn on Monday. It will be his first appearance for the network.
A CNNfn spokewsoman said that in coming weeks the network would begin producing another new show, focusing on mutual funds.
